When INVALID, CLOSED, or EXPIRED, withdrawal will not be possiblethat OPEN is present tense`msg.sender` is equal the recipient of the token`block.timestamp` is less than `expiration value` for valid withdrawal`_swapState[_swapID] = SwapState.CLOSED`    closes the order after successful withdrawal`_orderSwap[_swapID]._secretKey = _secretKey;` to update the secretKey value of the OrderSwap data for that ID"},"refund(bytes32)":{"notice":"`_order._issuer` should be msg.sender`_order._expiration` should be lesser than the current time. documentation.text:
@param _swapID is the id of the order to be fetched
 @notice `_swapID` must not be INVALID. it can be OPEN, CLOSED or EXPIRED.

params._swapID: is the id of the order to be fetched

openOrder(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,bytes3.details: when an order is opened, the issuer funds the contract with the tokenthis htlc contract address should be approved as an operator using "authorizeOperator" accross all partitions or "authorizeOperatorByPartition" for the specific partitions where tokens need to be deposited for the atomic swapwith the uniqueness of the IDS, the secrets dont have to be unique accross the blockchain. The unique ID will keep track of each unique swap orders

params._data: is the encoded certificate that will be decoded to ensure that the recipient is a whitelisted investor
params._expiration: is the time the token withdrawal elasp. There will be a refund to the issuer's wallet if the token isn't withdrawn
params._partition: is the partition where the token will be withdrawn into, in the investor's wallet
params._recipient: is the target recipient/withdrawal of the deposited token
params._secretHash: is the hash of the secret that must be provided by the recipient for the recipient to withdraw the security token
params._secretKey: is the secret word or phrase attached to an order
params._swapID: is the ID of the swap order that keeps track of the state of the order. The withdrawee will make reference to this ID on this contract and their deposit contract as well. The SwapState of that ID must be invalid which means it has not been used
params._tokenValue: is the amount of token to be withdrawn by the investor

params._secretKey: is the secret the recipient provides to withdraw the token from the htlc contract
params._swapID: is the ID of the order. The ID provided must be valid
is the id of the order to refunded to the issuer

ERC1400_TOKEN.details: The swap state solves some of the following security problem:

devdoc.title: HTLC to release security from issuer to investor

ERC1400_TOKEN().notice: If swap state if not monitored, recipient can attempt the expected amount to withdraw multiple times within the timeframeWhen the swap reaches expiration, before attempting to refund, it is needed to know the state of withdrawal. There is no need to refund the token if a withdrawal was successful

checkOrder(bytes32).notice: `_swapID` must not be INVALID. it can be OPEN, CLOSED or EXPIRED.

openOrder(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,bytes3.notice: ERC1400_TOKEN.operatorTransferByPartition function moves the tokens from the issuer wallets to the htlc address

recipientWithdrawal(bytes32,bytes32).notice: the existence of the hash of the secret is checked to be sure that it existthe swap state of the ID is checked to ensure that a recipient can only attempt a withdrawal when it's OPEN. When INVALID, CLOSED, or EXPIRED, withdrawal will not be possiblethat OPEN is present tense`msg.sender` is equal the recipient of the token`block.timestamp` is less than `expiration value` for valid withdrawal`_swapState[_swapID] = SwapState.CLOSED`    closes the order after successful withdrawal`_orderSwap[_swapID]._secretKey = _secretKey;` to update the secretKey value of the OrderSwap data for that ID

refund(bytes32).notice: `_order._issuer` should be msg.sender`_order._expiration` should be lesser than the current time.  In order words, the order has expired`ERC1400_TOKEN.transferByPartition` refunds the issuer`_swapState[_swapID] = SwapState.EXPIRED` sets the order's state to EXPIRED
